intro: Vittadinia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. It features small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and its leaves are usually lobed and hairy. Vittadinia triloba is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
